raw_response:
{
  "deal_structure": "Agreement and Plan of Merger dated September 22, 2025 among Compass, Inc. (\"Compass\"), Velocity Merger Sub, Inc. (Compass wholly owned sub), and Anywhere Real Estate Inc. (\"Anywhere\"). Structure is a forward triangular merger: Merger Sub merges with and into Anywhere, with Anywhere surviving as a wholly owned subsidiary of Compass. Consideration is all-stock: each share of Anywhere common stock (subject to customary excluded shares) converts into the right to receive 1.436 shares of Compass Class A common stock (the \"Exchange Ratio\"), plus cash in lieu of fractional shares. Transaction intended to qualify as a tax-free reorganization under IRC Section 368(a).  ",
  "purchase_price": "Per-share consideration: 1.436 shares of Compass Class A common stock for each Anywhere share (plus cash in lieu of fractional shares). No fixed cash price per share is specified in the provided excerpt, and no implied total equity value is stated in the provided excerpt. ",
  "conditions_to_closing": "Key conditions include: (i) Compass stockholder approval of the issuance of Compass shares in the merger (majority of outstanding Compass voting shares entitled to vote and represented at the meeting), (ii) Anywhere stockholder approval/adoption of the merger agreement (majority of outstanding Anywhere shares entitled to vote), (iii) NYSE authorization to list the Compass shares to be issued, (iv) effectiveness of Compass registration statement for the share issuance, (v) HSR waiting period expiration/termination, (vi) no injunction/order/law prohibiting the merger, (vii) accuracy of reps/warranties subject to agreed materiality standards, and (viii) material compliance with covenants/obligations. ",
  "termination_provisions": "Outside date: either party may terminate if the merger has not closed by September 22, 2026, subject to three automatic 3-month extensions if, on each such date, all closing conditions other than regulatory approvals have been satisfied or waived. Other termination rights include: final nonappealable prohibition; failure to obtain the required stockholder approvals (Compass can terminate for failure of Anywhere approval; Anywhere can terminate for failure of Compass approval); material uncured breach by the other party; and following a board recommendation change (Compass if Anywhere board changes recommendation; Anywhere if Compass board changes recommendation). Fee regime: (i) under certain specified circumstances, a $200 million termination fee is payable by Compass or Anywhere, as applicable; and (ii) if termination occurs because required regulatory clearances are not obtained before the Outside Date or the merger is permanently enjoined, Compass must pay Anywhere a $350 million termination fee (functionally a regulatory reverse termination fee payable by the buyer). Specific performance is available to compel performance of obligations.  ",
  "mac_provisions": "The provided excerpt does not include the definition of Material Adverse Effect/Material Adverse Change or its carve-outs; therefore MAC/MAE scope and carve-outs cannot be summarized from the provided text. ",
  "other_material_terms": "Non-solicitation: both parties are subject to non-solicitation obligations regarding alternative business combination proposals (no go-shop described in the provided excerpt).  Debt financing: Compass entered into a debt financing commitment letter on September 22, 2025 with Morgan Stanley Senior Funding, Inc. for up to $750 million of 364-day senior secured bridge financing; proceeds expected to refinance certain Anywhere indebtedness and pay related fees/expenses, with an intent to refinance via capital markets transactions and use the bridge only to the extent necessary. Anywhere’s existing senior notes are expected to remain in place post-close.  Support/voting agreements: Compass CEO/funds (approx. 29.6% voting power) agreed to vote in favor of Compass share issuance approval and to transfer-restrict shares (subject to exceptions); Angelo Gordon-managed funds (approx. 8.7% of Anywhere common) agreed to vote in favor of adopting the merger agreement and to transfer-restrict shares (subject to exceptions). ",
  "reasoning": "I extracted the banker-relevant economic and structural terms by locating the sections in the provided document that describe (i) the merger structure and consideration mechanics, (ii) closing conditions (stockholder, regulatory, listing/registration), (iii) termination rights/Outside Date and fee amounts, and (iv) other economically material deal protections and financing/support arrangements (non-solicit, financing commitment, voting/support agreements). Where the provided excerpt did not include the underlying MAE definition or any explicit implied equity value, I did not infer or speculate.",
  "reasoning_steps": [
    "Step 1: Located the transaction structure and economics by pulling the Merger Agreement description and Merger Consideration language (including the Exchange Ratio and treatment of fractional shares), plus any financing/support arrangements described alongside the agreement.",
    "Step 2: Validated conditions and termination economics by extracting the enumerated closing conditions, the Outside Date and extension mechanics, and the stated termination fee amounts and triggers (including the higher fee tied to regulatory failure/permanent injunction), and avoided summarizing items not present in the provided excerpt (e.g., MAE definition/carve-outs)."

parsed_response.deal_structure: Agreement and Plan of Merger dated September 22, 2025 among Compass, Inc. ("Compass"), Velocity Merger Sub, Inc. (Compass wholly owned sub), and Anywhere Real Estate Inc. ("Anywhere"). Structure is a forward triangular merger: Merger Sub merges with and into Anywhere, with Anywhere surviving as a wholly owned subsidiary of Compass. Consideration is all-stock: each share of Anywhere common stock (subject to customary excluded shares) converts into the right to receive 1.436 shares of Compass Class A common stock (the "Exchange Ratio"), plus cash in lieu of fractional shares. Transaction intended to qualify as a tax-free reorganization under IRC Section 368(a).
parsed_response.purchase_price: Per-share consideration: 1.436 shares of Compass Class A common stock for each Anywhere share (plus cash in lieu of fractional shares). No fixed cash price per share is specified in the provided excerpt, and no implied total equity value is stated in the provided excerpt.
parsed_response.conditions_to_closing: Key conditions include: (i) Compass stockholder approval of the issuance of Compass shares in the merger (majority of outstanding Compass voting shares entitled to vote and represented at the meeting), (ii) Anywhere stockholder approval/adoption of the merger agreement (majority of outstanding Anywhere shares entitled to vote), (iii) NYSE authorization to list the Compass shares to be issued, (iv) effectiveness of Compass registration statement for the share issuance, (v) HSR waiting period expiration/termination, (vi) no injunction/order/law prohibiting the merger, (vii) accuracy of reps/warranties subject to agreed materiality standards, and (viii) material compliance with covenants/obligations.
parsed_response.termination_provisions: Outside date: either party may terminate if the merger has not closed by September 22, 2026, subject to three automatic 3-month extensions if, on each such date, all closing conditions other than regulatory approvals have been satisfied or waived. Other termination rights include: final nonappealable prohibition; failure to obtain the required stockholder approvals (Compass can terminate for failure of Anywhere approval; Anywhere can terminate for failure of Compass approval); material uncured breach by the other party; and following a board recommendation change (Compass if Anywhere board changes recommendation; Anywhere if Compass board changes recommendation). Fee regime: (i) under certain specified circumstances, a $200 million termination fee is payable by Compass or Anywhere, as applicable; and (ii) if termination occurs because required regulatory clearances are not obtained before the Outside Date or the merger is permanently enjoined, Compass must pay Anywhere a $350 million termination fee (functionally a regulatory reverse termination fee payable by the buyer). Specific performance is available to compel performance of obligations.
parsed_response.mac_provisions: The provided excerpt does not include the definition of Material Adverse Effect/Material Adverse Change or its carve-outs; therefore MAC/MAE scope and carve-outs cannot be summarized from the provided text.
parsed_response.other_material_terms: Non-solicitation: both parties are subject to non-solicitation obligations regarding alternative business combination proposals (no go-shop described in the provided excerpt).  Debt financing: Compass entered into a debt financing commitment letter on September 22, 2025 with Morgan Stanley Senior Funding, Inc. for up to $750 million of 364-day senior secured bridge financing; proceeds expected to refinance certain Anywhere indebtedness and pay related fees/expenses, with an intent to refinance via capital markets transactions and use the bridge only to the extent necessary. Anywhere’s existing senior notes are expected to remain in place post-close.  Support/voting agreements: Compass CEO/funds (approx. 29.6% voting power) agreed to vote in favor of Compass share issuance approval and to transfer-restrict shares (subject to exceptions); Angelo Gordon-managed funds (approx. 8.7% of Anywhere common) agreed to vote in favor of adopting the merger agreement and to transfer-restrict shares (subject to exceptions).
parsed_response.reasoning: I extracted the banker-relevant economic and structural terms by locating the sections in the provided document that describe (i) the merger structure and consideration mechanics, (ii) closing conditions (stockholder, regulatory, listing/registration), (iii) termination rights/Outside Date and fee amounts, and (iv) other economically material deal protections and financing/support arrangements (non-solicit, financing commitment, voting/support agreements). Where the provided excerpt did not include the underlying MAE definition or any explicit implied equity value, I did not infer or speculate.
reasoning_steps: Step 1: Located the transaction structure and economics by pulling the Merger Agreement description and Merger Consideration language (including the Exchange Ratio and treatment of fractional shares), plus any financing/support arrangements described alongside the agreement.

Step 2: Validated conditions and termination economics by extracting the enumerated closing conditions, the Outside Date and extension mechanics, and the stated termination fee amounts and triggers (including the higher fee tied to regulatory failure/permanent injunction), and avoided summarizing items not present in the provided excerpt (e.g., MAE definition/carve-outs).
